docs.lead_paragraph: As the ranks of heroin users rise, increasing numbers of addicts are looking for help but are failing to find it — because there are no beds in packed facilities, treatment is hugely expensive and insurance companies won't pay for inpatient rehab.

headline.main: Heroin Addicts Face Barriers to Treatment
headline.print_headline: Heroin Addicts Face Barriers to Treatment

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans can't seem to reach an official party line this election year on the old Washington custom of using the federal budget to benefit the folks back home.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Brickner preached the virtues of home care, but his biggest accomplishment was helping to develop ways to treat people who do not have homes.

docs.lead_paragraph: House Republicans from high-unemployment regions planned to send the House speaker a letter urging him to take up the Senate bill or something similar.

headline.main: Senate Set to Pass Bill Extending Jobless Aid
headline.print_headline: Senate Set to Pass Bill Extending Jobless Aid

docs.abstract: Senate is expected to easily approve legislation restoring unemployment benefits to nearly three million people, throwing bill to divided House where Republicans favor starkly different approaches to the issue; House Republicans from high-unemployment regions plan to send House Speaker John A Boehner a letter urging him to take up Senate bill or something similar.
docs.snippet: House Republicans from high-unemployment regions planned to send the House speaker a letter urging him to take up the Senate bill or something similar.

docs.lead_paragraph: It's the Truvada conundrum: A drug hailed as a lifesaver for many people infected by HIV is at the heart of a rancorous debate among gay men, AIDS activists and health professionals over its potential for protecting uninfected men who engage in gay sex without using condoms.

headline.main: Gay Men Divided Over Use of HIV Prevention Drug
